com.github.daytron.daytronmoney.utility

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.daytron.daytronmoney.utility.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends Object
    Utility class for String formatting.
    Author:
    Ryan Gilera

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • parseAndRemoveCurrencyCode

        public static String[] parseAndRemoveCurrencyCode(String valueString)

        Extracts any characters prior to value (including the sign) and its value.

        Returns a String array as the result. The first element is the extracted currency code (could be an empty String if no extra characters found) while the second element is the value.

        Parameters:
        valueString - Input String to parse
        Returns:
        String array

      • removeCommas

        public static String removeCommas(String valueString)
        Reformats the text by removing all commas.
        Parameters:
        valueString - A String input.
        Returns:
        The newly formatted String without the commas.

      • analyzeDecimalValue

        public static long[] analyzeDecimalValue(String valueString)
        Parse and extracts leading zeros and the newly formatted String. Any leading and trailing zeros (excluding value is less than 10 can retain a single trailing zero) are analyzed and removed.
        Parameters:
        valueString - Input String to parse
        Returns:
        long array object

      • countLeadingZeros

        public static long countLeadingZeros(String valueString)
        Counts the number of leading zeros.
        Parameters:
        valueString - Input String to parse
        Returns:
        long value that represents the number of leading zeroes.

      • removeAnyLeadingZeroes

        public static String removeAnyLeadingZeroes(String valueString)
        Removes any leading zeroes. A single digit can retain one leading zero if the value it represents is less than 10.
        Parameters:
        valueString - Input String to format
        Returns:
        String formatted text

      • removeAnyTrailingZeroes

        public static String removeAnyTrailingZeroes(String valueString)
        Removes any leading zeroes. A single digit can retain one trailing zero if the value it represents is in tens.
        Parameters:
        valueString - Input String to format
        Returns:
        String formatted text

      • removeAnyLeadingAndTrailingZeroes

        public static String removeAnyLeadingAndTrailingZeroes(String value)
        Combines removing leading trailing methods in order. It is ideal to remove trailing zeroes first before removing any leading zeroes.
        Parameters:
        value - Input String to format
        Returns:
        String formatted text

      • combineValueIntoString

        public static String combineValueIntoString(long whole,
                                            long decimal,
                                            long leadingZeroes)
        Combines Money units into a String formate without the decimal point.
        Parameters:
        whole - long value for whole units
        decimal - long value for decimal units
        leadingZeroes - long value for any leading zeroes
        Returns:
        String formatted text
